sub_title: Knowledge Management Lead | Chevening & IDS Alumna
summary:
Nadhira’s professional background revolves around public policy and international development, with seven years of experience. Nadhira is currently working to improve the knowledge management framework within humanitarian/international organizations. She has a track record of working with the Government of Indonesia to transform the Indonesian health system, pass the law concerning the crime of sexual violence, accelerate the handle management of Covid-19, and the implementation planning of Sustainable Development Goals.

Nadhira graduated from the Institute of Development Studies, University of Sussex, with a Master of Arts in Governance, Development and Public Policy. She received Bachelor's degree in International Relations from Parahyangan Catholic University.

awards.title: Chevening Scholar
awards.description: Chevening is the UK Government’s global scholarship programme that offers future leaders the unique opportunity to study in the UK. These scholarships are awarded to outstanding professionals from Chevening-eligible country and beyond to pursue a one-year master’s degree in any subject at any UK university.
awards.issuer: Foreign and Commonwealth Office (FCO) - UK's Government

profile_positions.description:
Consult KM International is a registered London-based consultancy with a global outreach. Founded in 2021 and officially incorporated in July 2022, it is a young organization with a fresh outlook and a breadth of experience. Consult KM International mainly focuses on the international development/humanitarian and non-profit sectors and offers specialized services in knowledge management (KM), report and proposal writing, storytelling, research, editing/proofreading, graphic design, and more.

As a Knowledge Management Lead, I am responsible to:
1. Lead the development and adaptation of Knowledge Management (KM) methods and tools, such as pre-assessment, strategy, action plan, etc.
2. Identify, approach, and work directly with clients to provide KM services
3. Support senior-level KM consultants on various KM-related tasks and supervise junior-level KM consultant
profile_positions.title: Knowledge Management Lead

profile_positions.description:
Hired by the Asian Development Bank to work for the Minister of Health in the Centre for Health System and Strategy. Responsible to:

1. Advise Indonesia’s Ministry of Health in establishing partnerships with development partners and other counterparts.
2. Took leadership in Indonesia’s Ministry of Health’s global cooperations, resulting in the creation of the Pandemic Fund initiative, which raised USD 1.4 billion for pandemic prevention, preparedness and response.
3. Implement technical assistance and execute analysis of grants and loans in the health sector.
Writing Ministerial reports, presentations, and keynote speeches.
profile_positions.title: Partnership Specialist (Global Health)

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:

1. Assigned to work on social policy, including issues on women empowerment & children protection, education, public health, diaspora, SDGs, and One Data Indonesia.
2. Responsible to support intervention strategies for the Governments to create policies that aligned with the President’s direction through providing policy analysis, creating alternative solutions, and establishing & maintaining coordination with prominent stakeholders (Government and Non-Government Actors).
3. Support and provide the assistance of international development engagement.
4. Incorporated in:
a) Decree of the Presidential Chief of Staff of the Republic of Indonesia No. 6/2021 on the Task Force for the Acceleration of Formation of a Law on the Elimination of Sexual Violence.
b) Decree of the Deputy for System and Strategy of the National Disaster Management Agency No. 2/2020 on Assistance of the Technical Team for the Preparation of Protocols for the Acceleration of Covid-19 Response.

This position is equal to Echelon 3A Officials in the government offices.

Main Achievements:

1. Establish an additional feature for Covid-19 and health services on LAPOR!-SP4N, a citizen aspiration and complaints platform to increase accountability and transparency.
2. Succeed to support the formulation of Presidential Decree No. 7/2020 on the Acceleration of Covid-19 Handling Task Force.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Advisor to the Deputy Chief of Staff (Tenaga Ahli Muda)

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:

1. Local consultant for Feasibility Study (FS) of the Project Concept Paper (PCP): “Indonesia-Korea Quintuple-Helix Connectivity Hub” and “Project on Enhancing Marine Debris Management in Indonesia”.
2. Responsible to collect-in-depth information from counterparts; produce necessary technical consultation & feasible input; provide technical supports; and finalise PCP.

Main Achievement:
1. Deliver recommendations for the sustainability of the projects.
profile_positions.title: Local Consultant

Awarded to pursue master degree in Institute of Development Studies (IDS) - University of Sussex.

profile_positions.company: B A P P E N A S (Indonesian Ministry of National Development Planning)
profile_positions.title: Junior Program Officer for SDGs

profile_positions.location: Jl. Taman Suropati No.2, Jakarta Pusat
profile_positions.company: B A P P E N A S (Indonesian Ministry of National Development Planning)
profile_positions.description:
Worked for Secretariat SDGs under Directorate of Forestry and Water Conservation at Ministry of National Development Planning (Bappenas) Republic of Indonesia that is assigned to be the technical team in the planning of Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) Implementation in Indonesia.

My main responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

1. Support and assist all activities that related to SDGs Implementation Preparation such as drafting Presidential Regulations (Perpres); dissemination and socialization SDGs to all stakeholders as well as local government; preparing presentations and speech for Invited Speakers from Bappenas (Directors, Deputies, or Minister); and others.

2. Become a liaison between Bappenas and Secretariat of SDGs, as well as focal point/contact person to SDGs stakeholders (International Organizations, NGOs, Local Government, Media, etc) and related Ministries/Agencies.

3. Assist and support the preparation of International Forum/Conference/Workshop for Indonesian Delegates that related to SDGs such as United Nations General Assembly, G20, High-Level Political Forum, and others.

Main achievements:

1. Succeed to support the coordination to formulate and launch Presidential Decree No. 59/2017 on Sustainable Development Goals
2. Achieved to organise and formulate Indonesia’s Voluntary National Review (VNR) and coordinate Indonesian Delegates in the UN’s High-Level Political Forum (HLPF) 2017
3. Managed to coordinate Side Event on UN General Assembly 2016: Implementing 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development: from Global Commitment to Local Action (New York, 2016)

Other than SDGs, I also get involved in other project related to Pro-Poor Intended Nationally Determined Contribution (INDC) in Indonesia and assist activities in Directorate of Forestry and Water Conservation at Bappenas.
profile_positions.title: Assistant for SDGs

volunteer_experiences.description: Volunteer in a Non-Profit Organization that working to mainstream Bullying Issue in Indonesia. Had responsible to do campaign about bullying in Schools and get involved in survey making.

Steering Committee in a Non-Profit Organization that provides reading and literacy  support for children in Indonesia. Involved in some projects, including provides books for libraries and interacting with children through teaching.

One of 50 successful volunteers from more than 1000 applicants in a festival that hosted by the Ministry of Youth and Sports of the Republic of Indonesia. Had responsibility for building relations with embassies in Jakarta, mass media, and companies.
